column4: G'day all - does anyone know how to set the title of a gnome-terminal from a script running the the gnome-terminal?
it is set to user@host:~$
which script?
see "-t, --title=TITLE Set the terminal title" from "gnome-terminal --help-all".  good luck.  Eterm had that functionality back in the day as well.
you're right!  i tried and failed ???
that works like I'd expect it to work.... guess no-one uses gnome-terminal's titles on Ubuntu??

i just installed eterm and it works there, "Eterm -n NameYouWant"...  gnome-terminal I don't know about sorry.  FYI it's not a good idea to be writing scripts that reply on a windows name for the gui - what if it's running in a shell?  Good luck.
you need a !who and try and keep all you repsonses on 1 line - it's MUCH easier for everyone to follow stuff
oh I will use them for menu shortcuts and odds and ends
use TAB completion for nicks - mines still off ..ckK9 is wrong
thanks :-)
installed eterm .. but no eterm command?
no thank you for fixing the nic thing - now it highlights :) - Linux is case senitive so it's "Eterm"
right... let me try that .... :-)
if you ask me it's a bug...
is it a bug? (now it is :-P)
actually after reading my first google hit i doubt it is.  something to do with dynamic naming in gnome-terminal.
its probably a "feature" ... like I said I think it does change it but then something else changes it back!
guess I need to find a way to kill the "something else"
found the problem.... even though /etc/bash.bashrc section is commented out
its still in ~/.bashrc
so after commenting out that bit, things like xtermset -T "title" work....
thanks for helping to think about this :-)
# If this is an xterm set the title to user@host:dir nice catch :)
